page.title: 13Timbersbrook Now
page.content: When many years later I return to Timbersbrook For all the sights and sounds I deeply yearn In Timbersbrook, The flowers in the hedgerows still are growing But breezes through an empty space are blowing And things have changed because no cocks are crowing In Timbersbrook The mill has gone that they named Silver Springs In Timbersbrook The calling bell to work no longer rings In Timbersbrook Though cattle in the meadow still are lowing No horses to the water trough are going But,saddest thing of all,no cocks are crowing In Timbersbrook Frank Stockton
